title: Drawing, "Designs of Bolts and a Hinge", ca. 1790
medium: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper
markings: Watermark: Pro Patria, to left, over B
inscribed: Inscribed in ink, inverted, upper: Verroux a resor[te]; vertically inscribed in ink, left center: fiche à vasse; above hinge, inverted: aile; below hinge, inverted: aile; below lower bolt: verroux à resor. Sur platinne, et, a queu, / a vecque poygné tournante.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Upper bolt in shape of an octagonal escutcheon with rinceaux decor; lower bolt, same except for curved escutcheon; center, hinge has six holes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Designs of Bolts and a Hinge", ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-189.
